climbs.name: Witness Stand
climbs.fa: Bob Gaines and Roddy McCaley, Dec. 2012

content.description:
This is a short, steep, tightly bolted sport climb located just left of

Alibi

. Power through a bulge on patina jugs to a tricky stand-up, then make a delicate traverse left to a sloper finish.
content.protection:
6 bolts to a 2-bolt anchor (50 feet)

The 5th bolt is tricky to clip. I had no problem clipping it by bridging my right foot and left palm in opposition and clipping with my right hand. Use a long draw and you won't fall as far if you blow the clip.

The 6th bolt is superfluous for the leader and serves as a directional for the folllower to prevent a swing from the last hard moves.

climbs.name: Uppercut
climbs.fa: Bob Gaines and Frank Bentwood, December 2009

content.description:
Far left side of the Solarium, begins left of the big corner/gully.

Climb a face past 2 bolts (5.9) up to a ledge, then lieback a short, right-facing dihedral to a right-slanting crack under a roof. Pumper jams (hand to fingers) with a tricky exit.

2 bolt lower off anchor (100 ft.)
content.protection: .4 to 4 inches, 2 bolts. 2 bolt lower-off anchor.

content.description: This is the low-angle slab just right of Solar Panel, that can be toproped from the 2-bolt anchor shared with Broken Hearted.
content.protection: Shared bolt anchor with Broken Hearted
content.location: Between the diagonal gully of Solar Panel and Broken Hearted

climbs.name: Tim's Valentine
climbs.fa: Bob Gaines and Patty Kline, December 2009

content.description: Quality slab climbing on smears and patina edges lead up to and past an overlap and some stemming before reaching the anchors. A little crispy in spots but generally quite solid.
content.protection:
6 bolts, chain anchors (shared with

Remembering Marina

)

Anchor upgraded on 11/2014
content.location: The right-most of three bolted routes above the left side of the ledge at the base.

content.description:
This is the big, low-angle corner on the left side of the central slab, ending in a short layback.

Follow the crack up to the top avoiding the various small plants and lizards that call it home.

For a toprope variation,  when your feet get to the horizontal crack, traverse to the right to the anchors for Broken Hearted/Turkey Breast and lower off from there.
content.location: Start at the bush between Uppercut and Turkey Breast.

content.description:
Slab climb up patina edges and smears past a short right-facing corner (crux) with interesting stemming moves to a slight runout onto a ledge below a bulge with the last bolt where a quick pull on edges leads to anchors.

The aforementioned runout is on easy terrain but if so desired a large knob can be slung by reaching down from the ledge above the 4th bolt.
content.location: The middle of three bolted routes above the left side of the ledge at the base.

climbs.name: Out of Order
climbs.fa: Bob Gaines, Frank Bentwood & Bruce Boe, December 2009

content.description: Easy terrain quickly gives way to a tricky lieback past the first bolt and into a devious crux sequence moving past a horizontal crack (crux). Higher a bit of slab climbing culminates with a delicate mantle over the rounded lip to anchors over the top.
content.protection: 3 bolts, ring anchors (shared with Alibi and Witness Stand)
content.location:
Between

Alibi

and Exhibit A and about 60' right of

Tim's Valentine

.

climbs.name: Knockout
climbs.fa: Bob Gaines and Chris Baumann, March 2020

content.description:
Begin by climbing about 1/2 way up the corner of

Solar Panel

(5.0), then move left and clip a bolt just above a Yucca plant. From here the route is sport-bolted (6 bolts total) to a 2-bolt anchor.

The crux, at the very top, above the last bolt, is height dependent. If you're shorter than about 5 foot 9 inches tall it'll be much more challenging (5.10) and you might need to dyno for the lip at the top!
content.protection: Optional pro, to 2 inches, then 6 bolts to a 2-bolt anchor.

content.description: Climb the slab past a mixture of smears and edges to a crux encounter up high as you pull over a small roof/overlap. The rock on this route leaves something to be desired down low as each ascent will probably be a "fresh step" but thankfully the crux moves are on solid patina.
content.location:
Between

Tim's Valentine

and

Remembering Marina

.

climbs.name: Broken Hearted
climbs.fa: Bob Gaines, Frank Bentwood & Al Sanderson, December 2009

content.description:
A scrappy high step starts this route which is steeper and sharper than its immediate neighbors to the right.  Fairly continuous climbing leads to the crux at the third bolt.  After surmounting the headwall, the climbing becomes easier climbing a scoop up to the ledge. You can either cross to the anchors for

Tim's Valentine

, or climb through the next face (gear) to another anchor.
content.protection: 5 bolts, a few pieces if climbing past the second headwall to anchors.
content.location:
Two routes left of

Tim's Valentine

.

content.description: Toprope the face between Turkey Breast and Broken Hearted begining with slab moves up to a short, vertical jamcrack that peters out. Slab climbing leads to the top.
content.protection: Can be toproped from the 2-bolt anchor shared with Broken Hearted.

climbs.name: Alibi
climbs.fa: Bob Gaines, Frank Bentwood & Bruce Boe, December 2009

content.description:
Interesting climbing on vertical patina plates gives way to a engaging sequence of thin crimps and sloping smears (crux) just past the 2nd bolt. Once the third bolt is reached a few more smears lead up and slightly left to a rounded mantle and anchors up and over the top.

Although short this is a high quality route that deserves more attention.
content.protection: Fixed pin, 3 bolts, ring anchors (shared with Out of Order and Witness Stand)
content.location:
Just left of

Out of Order

, two routes left of Exhibit A and about 50' right of

Tim's Valentine

.
